publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2526 Christine Grahame: Jamie Oliver Invitation—That the Parliament commends the efforts of the chef, Jamie Oliver, in his endeavours to improve the quality of school meals, in particular given the worrying increase in childhood obesity with its unavoidable health implications, including a documented increase in childhood diabetes; further notes that his menus have been trialled and adopted in 25 schools across Greenwich; commends his reality check, "the Grub Log", encouraging parents to log their children’s food intake, and urges the Scottish Executive to meet Mr Oliver to discuss his proposals with a view to providing pilots and ultimately funding for his menus. Supported by: Fergus Ewing*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Mary Scanlon*, Jim Mather*, Rob Gibson*, Eleanor Scott*, Robin Harper*, John Swinburne*
S2M-2526 Jamie Oliver Invitation (lodged on 4 March 2005) Alex Neil*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2526 Jamie Oliver Invitation (lodged on 4 March 2005) Mr John Swinney*, Michael Matheson*
S2M-2526 Jamie Oliver Invitation (lodged on 4 March 2005) Roseanna Cunningham*
S2M-2526 Jamie Oliver Invitation (lodged on 4 March 2005) Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*
